channel.title: Help with some algebra :S
channel.description:
because these are word problems they end up being kinda long so bare with me here :D
there are two planes, plane #1 is flying at 30,000 feet and descending at a steady rate of 25 mph, while plane #2 is at 4,000 feet ascending at 15 mp but leaves 16 seconds after plane #1. At what point will the planes meet? :confused:
im not really expecting you to solve the problem just help me set up the equation. Im haveing a lot of trouble integrating the height at which each of them begins. Any help is appreciated, thanks :cool:

item.title: Help with some algebra :S
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

I’m really good at Algebra, but hate doing word problems. I always got stuck on them in Algebra II. AP Statistics/Probability deals with word problems too, but it pretty interesting.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with some algebra :S
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Ok, here’s the equation for plane #1’s elevation: (h = hours)

[tt]elevation = 30,000 - 132,000h.[/tt]

and plane #2:

[tt]elevation = 4,000 + 79,200h.[/tt]

So, just set them equal to find out what time they will meet:

[tt]4,000 + 79,200h = 30,000 - 132,000h

211,200h = 26,000

h = 0.123106061[/tt]

Now, you have the time in hours, so plug it back into one of the formulas above:

[tt]elevation = 30,000 - (0.123106061 * 132,000)

elevation = 30,000 - 16,250.0001

height = 13,749.9999[/tt]

They will meet at an elevation of 13,749.9999 feet.

Hope I helped,

-Weibs.

Read full topic
